tweets.text:
⚠️ Two Severe Flood Warnings have now been issued by @EnvAgency for The River Nene.

The Northampton Washlands have now been fully utilised and fast flowing deep water is causing a severe risk to life. https://t.co/5R36Bo1mbN

Flood Alert declared by @EnvAgencySE  for River Thames from Hurley to Cookham. To report flooding in our area, or to contact the local Environment Agency Duty Officer, call the EA's Incident Hotline on 0845 850 3518. https://t.co/DwurrejLCc

We have issued two severe #flood warnings at Cogenhoe Mill Caravan Site and Billing Aquadrome due to flood risk in the #Northampton area.
 
We're working closely with the emergency services who are now evacuating these sites. Stay safe and don’t walk or drive through floodwater.
There’s more...@WUFoundation @EnvAgency @NatResWales https://t.co/IVFP8fdsJE

Our @EnvAgencyMids Operations field teams have been out all night and all day across #Gloucestershire #Worcestershire #Herefordshire #Shropshire #clearing #clamping #closing #monitoring Our Flood duty staff have also been monitoring and responding throughout #covidsafe #TeamEA https://t.co/GveT3nJqeV

entity.name: Christmas
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations for Christmas for all years.

tweets.text:
When cooking #ChristmasDinner, don’t pour fats, oils, grease and scraps down the sink as this can lead to a build-up of #fatbergs, causing blockages and pollution. 

Leave them to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. 

Don’t feed a festive fatberg. https://t.co/mJx5p2fM9H

tweets.text:
It's been calculated that Britons pour 15 million cups of roast #turkey fat down the kitchen sink on December 25th 

That’s enough to nearly fill an Olympic swimming pool!

You can help by scraping leftover cooking oils into food waste or bins rather than down the sink https://t.co/GZJR7w4fU6

tweets.text:
Everyone from #TeamEA would like to wish our followers all the very best for over the festive season.

Our account will continue to be active over the holidays, but remember to report any environmental incidents to us on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/aGmYHRjF9I
Good evening from Red, we've just taken over from Green for our last night, stay safe and have a good Christmas all https://t.co/0jzPerMuSD

tweets.text:
Good evening fellow residents of St Ives. There has been a food warning for our area, issued by @EnvAgency. Please can you all click on the link below and check what you need to do, just to be sure and safe:
https://t.co/RN6bA4d8gN

A huge thank you to the @EnvAgencyMids team, one of which was out with me last night in the pouring rain checking on pumping equipment by the river and this morning the same person was out in waders digging out twigs, branches and a wheelie bin from the beck. #dedication 🎄👏🏻 https://t.co/5WqbqiTx4H
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/ympauygh8k

@votemikeadams @EnvAgencyMids Thank you for rescuing our Wheelie Bin!

Not all hero's wear capes!

There are #FloodWarnings in place across England.  

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L 

#Flooding https://t.co/xMZ6fkrPDL

#Floods Warnings in Thames catchment for Evenlode, Cherwell and Ray, all flow into the Thames. Expect to see flooding onto the #ThamesPath in the next few days. 

Avoid using the Thames Path if it is flooded - divert, don't drown! @RamblersGB @EnvAgencySE @ODS_doinggood https://t.co/W88Sc9w8Kv

Planning to spend time in or near a river this Christmas? Fishing, canoeing or walking?

Remember to #CheckCleanDry your footwear and equipment to help prevent the spread of invasive diseases

https://t.co/CaopPwbarM https://t.co/NeWvOM5u40

tweets.text:
The latest on the #StratfordUponAvon temporary barriers is they're not going to be erected tomorrow. The river level is not as high as originally forecast.

⚠️Keep up-to-date with the latest situation: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20

⚠️Sign up for #flood warnings https://t.co/hquuoBs8hF https://t.co/rr8vhQsnkC

Property flooding is not predicted but if you have concerns check the 5-day flood risk forecast: https://t.co/paEZ9Q3HqC

* Or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 using quickdial code: 171216 

* Follow @EnvAgency and #floodaware

Flooding can happen at any time⚠️

Watch the video for four things you can do to prepare this festive period👇 

Sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/P6B524qsJt #Flood #Christmas https://t.co/RGoveolPc4

The #Warwickshire field team has been hard at work today clearing debris screens & checking key assets all around the county following last night's rainfall, including here at Snitterfield, Long Itchington & Stratford-Upon-Avon

#flooding #FloodAware https://t.co/Eo2kwZ0qO8

With the East Suffolk coast being so vulnerable to erosion & flooding, when will @BorisJohnson @AlokSharma_RDG @beisgovuk @The_ONR @EnvAgency @EastSuffolk @suffolkcc realise the folly of storing toxic radioactive waste on the Sizewell beach for 150yrs or more...
#SayNo2SizewellC https://t.co/GZbF6i08Wk https://t.co/TSVwTe8Nr6

tweets.text:
With #StormBella arriving on #BoxingDay (Saturday into Sunday) it is important to stay close to @EnvAgency #flood warnings: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY
Stay safe, stay #floodaware #TeamEA https://t.co/OToa87AQNI

If you're walking your dog near the reed bed in @CountessPark please don't let it jump into the water & certainly don't follow it in. The culverts leading from it are deep as someone discovered this week. We've put more signs up today for your safety
@ShitChester @GPorterStandard https://t.co/S0tFEtGKKE

In the words of @ZacGoldsmith "Natural England, the Environment Agency and the Forestry Commission...rely on the support of the general public in reporting possible illegal activity and pollutions." Over to you folks. @DaveThroupEA @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency

tweets.text: My heartfelt thoughts are with anyone who has been flooded overnight. Rain has cleared, but larger rivers Gt Ouse, Nene and Severn still high. Watch out for Storm Bella Saturday into Sunday - high winds, rain in north & west, heavy seas. Stay #FloodAware https://t.co/wnrN3PVhxa https://t.co/nB8P8cuYYj

#DYK Fatbergs create blockages in sewers & stop dirty water reaching the treatment works so there’s a risk of sewage spilling out into homes, streets, rivers or the sea. 

Cooking the #ChristmasDinner? You can help by scraping leftover cooking oils into the food waste or bin! https://t.co/t7o244kXpE

tweets.text:
We often urge you not to drive through floodwater - 30mm/12ins can move a car...

The same goes for taking care on riverbanks and paths... 

Please avoid walking, running and cycling through standing water close to rivers...

Pix: Pangbourne, Berkshire, 2019
#floodaware https://t.co/ao98uvK0Dk
